page.title: 13Cyfarthfa Castle & Museum.
page.content: Cyfarthfa Castle is a magnificent Grade 1 listed building in the style of a medieval castle.It was built in the 1820's for the Crawshay family of ironmasters.It's appearance is grand with battlements,turrets,tower and a portcullis.It was taken over by the Merthyr Borough Council and converted into a grammar school.Part of it is now a comprehensive school while a large part of it is a museum which houses many of Merthyr's industrial and cultural relics.It is surrounded by beautiful gardens,woods and overlooks a large lake.Nowadays the castle and its surrounding parkland is a focal point for historians and people who enjoy fishing and walking.Each year several shows are held in the castle grounds.These include a Country Fair,a Fete and Gala and a Horse Show.
